answers.a: Potassium aluminium silicate is a different additive (E555), a naturally occurring aluminosilicate used mainly as an anti‑caking or glazing agent; it is not the same as E560. E560 is potassium silicate (K2SiO3), an inorganic silicate salt.

answers.q: what is the formula of potassium silicate
answers.a: The common form is potassium metasilicate, K2SiO3. Commercial potassium silicate is often represented as K2O·nSiO2 (various ratios) and may be hydrated.

answers.q: : hydrated potassium sodium iron magnesium aluminum silicate is better known as what?
answers.a: Mica (e.g., muscovite/biotite), which is different from E560 potassium silicate.
That refers to a Canon printer model and is unrelated to the food additive E560; in food, E560 denotes potassium silicate (K2SiO3), an inorganic silicate salt.

answers.q: how di i gointo bios with a lenova thinkpad e560
answers.a: That’s a laptop model unrelated to the food additive E560; here, E560 refers to potassium silicate (K2SiO3).
